edu.rit.util

Class IntPair<K>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.util.PairBase<K>
      • edu.rit.util.IntPair<K>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - Key data type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable

    public class IntPair<K>
extends PairBase<K>
    Class IntPair encapsulates a pair consisting of a key and its associated value of type int. The key must be an object suitable for use in a hashed data structure; that is, the key class must define the equals() and hashCode() methods properly. The key may be null. Once a key is stored in a pair, the state of the key must not be altered. The value stored in a pair may be changed.

    Class IntPair is streamable. For object streaming to work properly, the key class must be streamable or serializable.

        public void writeOut(OutStream out)
              throws IOException
        Write this object's fields to the given out stream. The key is written using writeObject(). The value is written using writeInt().

        Throws:
